description: From Latin clima, from Ancient Greek κλίμα (klíma, “(zone of) latitude”, literally “inclination”), from κλίνω (klínō, “to slope, incline”). See also climate.

entries.meaning: A particular region defined by its weather or climate.
examples: After working hard all of his life, Max retired to warmer climes in Florida.
A change of clime was exactly what the family needed.
